Text:
1080p...
Just noticed the ridiculous mistake at the description.

Video is x264
Audio is AC3
Container is M2TS (BDAV)
4gb for 3hr movie each. It has to be ridiculously bad quality.

@jenchai

I'm proud of you, you have made the best assumption of the century.

@jenchai - be careful about displaying your ignorance.  M2TS files are much smaller than .mkv - you really can't make the assumption that you make based on size alone.

Thanks for the upload DownTYU.  Downloading now - will comment on quality after I see it.

Thanks. For the small file size the quality is amazing. But if you really need top notch go for the 77 gig trilogy. This is good, props to the encoder / uploader , but there is some blocking-noise , especially at faster scenes, so again, this is good , if you need perfection, you'll want to wait a bit longer and finish the bigger sized upload.
For bluray 1080 rip i'd say:

V 8
A 9

I was a bit quick in my judgement. These videos looked ok in the beginning, to me, but as I am watching I'm getting more and more annoyed by the shortcomings. Not sharp, 2 blocky. You'd better dowload a comparable size 720p rip, it will have lots less blocks and noise and will be sharper. Still props to reducing it 2 so small a filesize, but the quality really takes a hit compared to the source. And thats missing the essence in doing a 1080p rip I believe.
So I have to downscale my rating:

V 6.5
A 9 (ratings compared to bluray)
Piff can some do i 4gb ish per movie upload....
just wondering, are the elvish subs hardcoded?

LAME, the quality is poor.

Uploader's a noob, this is too rubbish for 1080p, don't get it guys.
